channel.title: Data Engineering Portfolio on Patrick DeBiasse
channel.description: Recent content in Data Engineering Portfolio on Patrick DeBiasse

item.title: Project III: Data Engineering
item.description: Abstract: In this data engineering project, I use X Y Z to A B C. (This project is in the works! Once complete, all code used can be found on my github here.)

item.title: Project II: Air Quality in Salt Lake City
item.description: Abstract: In this data analytics project, I investigate how Salt Lake City’s air quality has changed over time by using python to read 38 years of csv files from a government website into pandas dataframes, then using matplotlib to identify any trends visually. After identifying the two primary pollutants causing poor air quality in the valley, I discuss how we might be able to reduce them. The Jupyter Notebook used to write this post can be found on my github here.

item.title: Project I: R is for Art
item.description: Abstract: In this data analytics project, I use a variety of R packages to download and manipulate XYZ elevation data into a 3D model of one of Salt Lake City’s most popular hikes. The R Markdown file used to write this post can be found on my github. Background: A common source of anxiety when flying is anticipating your immediate neighbors - the sniffler who’s “pretty sure it’s just allergies”, freaked out children, the max-screen-brightness-iPad on red-eye wielder.

item.title: About
item.description: Education: M.S. Analytics, Georgia Institute of Technology (in progress) B.S. Mechanical Engineering, New Jersey Institute of Technology (2017) Professional experience: Teladoc Health: Sr. analyst working with medical claims (SQL) BD: 3-year engineering rotational program, then analytics (SQL, Power BI) Feel free to connect with me via patrick.debiasse@gmail.com or LinkedIn!
